The actual contact point details, in a form that is meaningful to the designated communication system (i.e. phone number or email address).
column14: Additional text data such as phone extension numbers, or notes about use of the contact are sometimes included in the value.
column15: Need to support legacy numbers that are not in a tightly controlled format.

column13: Purpose of this contact point
column14: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not mistake a temporary or old contact etc.for a current/permanent one. Applications can assume that a contact is current unless it explicitly says that it is temporary or old.
column15: Need to track the way a person uses this contact, so a user can choose which is appropriate for their purpose.

column12: Specify preferred order of use (1 = highest)
column13: Specifies a preferred order in which to use a set of contacts. Contacts are ranked with lower values coming before higher values.
column14: Note that rank does not necessarily follow the order in which the contacts are represented in the instance.
